item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:25, topic:279831”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=369271.msg2799432#msg2799432 date=1243280305]

i like them both alot =]. good job if they were done in blender i would like a copy of the 1st one =]

lolz thanks but they where made in meta, after I get last one do I will post and let people pick which one they want released, and I am goign to post V2 of the 1st one.
[/quote]

instead of releasing just 1, you should release the 1 people want overall, and then give other people the 1 they want via pm.[/quote]
I am goign to make a poll so people can vote for the one they want the most. and i will release that, but anyways thanks for the post.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 25, 2009, 07:34:20 pm[/size][hr][quote=“primadude, post:26, topic:279831”]I don’t like the first one but the second one is good.[/quote]
ok thanks.

item.title: My swords(new sword added)
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“wayzey, post:5, topic:279831”]Very nice, on closer inspection the handle would have been very easy to make and somehow you made it look fantastic!

Main advice i’ll give you is that you need to curve the blade more so it’s smoother. This is unless of course you are aiming to give the blade a defined crease.
Also try to make the hilt and handle better. They look pretty damn good like that but you can make them much better be modifying your primitive objects. Remember you can scale, rotate and move parts of your primitives incase you didn’t know.[/quote]
lolz thanks for the 1st part the 2nd part I know if you look back a bit I have made guitars and what not I am only making these sword by request from a server I am modeling for, I know how to scale and stuff dun worry also on my post I said I could of added more detail.

Read full topic

item.title: My swords(new sword added)
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

Very nice, on closer inspection the handle would have been very easy to make and somehow you made it look fantastic!

Main advice i’ll give you is that you need to curve the blade more so it’s smoother. This is unless of course you are aiming to give the blade a defined crease.
Also try to make the hilt and handle better. They look pretty damn good like that but you can make them much better be modifying your primitive objects. Remember you can scale, rotate and move parts of your primitives incase you didn’t know.

Read full topic
